name: Grizzly Ranch Golf Club
description: Neighboring the million-acre Plumas National Forest, the course features a sprawling par-72 layout with five sets of tees, generous fairways with wide landing zones, and a mountainous landscape with elevations ranging from 4,800 to 5,400 feet. From the black tees at 7,411 yards to the forward tees at 5,374 yards, golfers of all levels can enjoy playing a seemingly endless combination of shots. A natural turf practice range complements perfectly the abundance of nature surrounding Grizzly Ranch. With a 30-station tee box, putting and chipping greens, and bunker areas, the Practice Facility welcomes members and guests to majestic views and clean mountain air making this a perfect place to relax before starting your round.

faqs.question: What’s included in Grizzly Ranch golf group packages?
faqs.answer: Lodging, guaranteed tee times at Grizzly Ranch, carts, and concierge planning. Optional transportation and dining add-ons.

faqs.question: What do Grizzly Ranch group packages cost?
faqs.answer: Typical range is $179–$599 per golfer depending on season, lodging, and group size.

faqs.question: Do you handle corporate and tournament groups?
faqs.answer: Yes—room blocks, multi-course itineraries, and tournament services are available for corporate and leisure groups.

pointOfView: It's quite an achievement to be recognized by Golf Digest as a Top 100 Greatest Public Course in the US, but once you play Grizzly Ranch, you'll know why it's been recognized as such. It's big, beautiful, and as natural as can be! The design weaves up and down through undulating topography with holes laid out to compliment it, not disfigure it. Fescue grasses rise thickly beyond the secondary cuts of rough, with Mule's Ear and forest debris creating impenetrable thicket from which a successful recovery shot is as much luck as it is skill to execute. You'll need to let the big dog eat here though if you want to score low, as length is a major advantage. Two drivable par 4s can help make that dream a reality, however, and the all-grass practice range will help you to dial in the day's swing. Take time to calculate yardages as some tee shots can find hazards unseen from tee boxes and fairways, particularly hole no. 3's second shot, and tee shots on holes 12 and 17. You'll find Grizzly Ranch in impeccable shape with fairways cut tight and greens rolling smooth and quick. The Lake House is not to be missed for post-round reflection or an at-the-turn beer and bite. The overall development has been built to be one with nature and it achieves that with minimally invasive structural designs and color schemes. Grizzly Ranch should not be missed on any golf trip to the High Sierra, but make it all it can be with a paired round at Whitehawk Ranch or Plumas Pines, and a stay at Plumas Pines Golf Resort. You won't be sorry!

featuredHole.title: Hole #6 — Par 4
featuredHole.description: A stunning par 4 with Grizzly Creek winding along the right side. The approach plays over a natural meadow to an elevated green. The mountain backdrop and wildflowers in summer make it Graeagle's most photographed hole.

testimonials.quote: Grizzly Ranch Golf Club delivers every time. This was our third trip and the course keeps getting better. Par 3s are memorable, greens are quick and true. Best value for championship golf in the Graeagle, CA area.
testimonials.author: Luke C.

testimonials.quote: Our corporate outing at Grizzly Ranch Golf Club was flawless. Golf the High Sierra coordinated tee times, box lunches, and awards dinner. The course challenged our scratch golfers and was still fun for the high-handicappers.
testimonials.author: Jeff E.
